alert.note: Alert for Central St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake; Southern Lake, North Shore (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 9:11AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...AN AREA OF HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS WILL AFFECT EAST CENTRAL ST. LOUIS AND SOUTHWESTERN LAKE COUNTIES... At 909 AM CDT, an area of heavy snow showers were along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Eveleth, to near Wolf Lake, to Highland Lake, and moving east at 35 mph. Visibilities of 1/4 mile or less, wind gusts up to 35 mph, and rapid snow accumulation on roads are expected with this area of heavy snow showers. This area of heavy snow showers will be near... Wolf Lake around 915 AM CDT. Brimson around 920 AM CDT. Castle Danger around 925 AM CDT. Highland Lake around 930 AM CDT. Thomas Lake Near Brimson and Whiteface Reservoir around 935 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this area of heavy snow showers include Gooseberry Falls State Park, Wales, Markham, Pequaywan Lake, Makinen, Alger and Split Rock Lighthouse State Park. Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a quarter of a mile in this area of heavy snow showers. Be prepared for changing visibility and road conditions. Reduce your speed and allow more space between you and the vehicle in front of you.

area.areaDesc: Central St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake; Southern Lake, North Shore
